node.title: A 'Kangaroo court' over a Kangaroo Island port: How SA's Deputy Premier is caught in an unwelcome spotlight
node.alt: A woman wearing a black blazer, white top and glasses sits in front of a microphone. She is holding a binder of papers
node.description: SA Deputy Premier Vickie Chapman is embroiled in a conflict-of-interest saga which is soaking up political oxygen for the government as it tries to reopen borders and prepare for next March's election.
node.content:
["While the behaviour of MPs in Victoria and New South Wales\u00a0is currently under the spotlight, a parliamentary inquiry in SA is threatening the political future of the state's Deputy Premier.", "Vickie Chapman is embroiled in a conflict-of-interest saga that\u00a0is soaking up political oxygen for the SA government as it tries to reopen borders and prepare for next March's election.", "With a fortnight of parliamentary hearings complete and a report into Ms Chapman's handling of a port proposal on Kangaroos Island set to be tabled in Parliament next week, one of SA's most hardened politicians is sharply in focus.", "
Who is Vickie Chapman?
", "Vickie Chapman is a long-serving, high-profile South Australian Liberal MP who became the state's first female deputy premier after the party won the 2018 election.", "Following a ministerial reshuffle amid\u00a0the country members accommodation allowance saga in July 2020, she added Planning and Local Government to her list of portfolios which already included Attorney-General.", "In August, she used her powers to refuse an application to build a deep-sea port at Smith Bay on Kangaroo Island's north coast.", "It was to be used to transport plantation timber off the island.", "When she revealed her decision, Ms Chapman said it was a \"difficult\"\u00a0call.", "She said an assessment report by South Australia's Planning Commission found the application was \"finely balanced\"\u00a0with a number of matters which would require \"significant and ongoing management\".", "The report also found the proposal should be granted provisional development authorisation, subject to conditions being met.", "
Why could a port decision be a problem?
", "Ms Chapman's family hails from Kangaroo Island.", "She grew up there and her father Ted was the local state MP for nearly 20 years.", "She has property interests on the island and maintains a relationship with the local community.", "", "
The house owned by Vickie Chapman, bottom,\u00a0is next to a timber plantation on Kangaroo Island.(ABC News)
", "Last month, South Australia's Lower House of Parliament voted to set up a select committee to investigate Ms Chapman's conduct relating to the decision to deny the application to build the port.", "The state government, led by Premier Steven Marshall, is currently in minority with the Labor opposition and crossbench voting in favour of setting up the committee.", "Its terms of reference include looking into any conflict of interest, abuse of office or breach of the state's ministerial code of conduct by Ms Chapman in relation to the decision.", "She has repeatedly rejected suggestions that she had a conflict of interest and has branded the committee a witch hunt.", "
What have we learnt from the hearings?
", "On the first day witnesses were called, a map was produced showing Ms Chapman's property was across the road from a forest which was to be felled if the port had been approved.", "", "
Ms Chapman has threatened to sue Tom Koutsantonis.(ABC News)
", "Former executives from Kangaroo Island Plantation Timbers \u2013 the proponent of the port \u2014 told the committee Ms Chapman was a surprise attendee at a meeting about the development in 2017 with then-MP and now Mayor Michael Pengilly while still in opposition.", "Emails from Ms Chapman's ministerial planning adviser show he understood she was likely to declare a conflict on the matter, a decision she didn't end up making.", "In evidence, a Crown Solicitor said she prepared documents to allow the Attorney-General to delegate her decision. Ms Chapman didn't do that either.", "When she fronted the inquiry in person, Ms Chapman denied she had an actual or perceived conflict, insisting that neither she\u00a0nor her family had \"any advantage, or benefit\"\u00a0or avoided any detriment by her decision.", "She also hit out at some of the committee members for their conduct, accusing the opposition of attempting to politicise her brother's suicide in 2017.", "\"The approach that's been taken in the undertaking of this inquiry, to have some kind of pre-election issue of the day, media statement, is just a charade and it's just a nonsense and it's a very, very expensive one,\" she said.", "Late on Friday, Ms Chapman launched a defamation threat against committee member Tom Koutsantonis, in a bid to halt the parliamentary investigation.", "An opposition spokesperson said the legal threat appears to be a \"last ditch, desperate attempt\"\u00a0by the Attorney-General to save her political career.", "
What's Premier Steven Marshall doing?
", "Backing his deputy \"100 per cent\".", "Steven Marshall is standing firmly with Vickie Chapman.", "", "
Steven\u00a0Marshall with Vickie\u00a0Chapman in 2018, shortly after the state election.(ABC News: Nick Harmsen)
", "\"I'm not really that concerned about what other people think,\" he told reporters on Wednesday.", "\"I'm quite sure that Vickie Chapman was the right person to make this decision. There's been no bias. She's made the right decision.", "Mr Marshall also rebuffed a push for him to front the committee after it was told two senior MPs \u2013 David Ridgway and Treasurer Rob Lucas \u2013 were going to broach the issue with him.", "Mr Ridgway, who has since left Parliament and is South Australia's agent-general in London, says he didn't speak to Steven Marshall about Ms Chapman's potential conflict of interest with the port.", "Through a statement, Mr Lucas said he has \"lots\" of conversations with his parliamentary colleagues, including\u00a0the Premier, about lots of different things and \"I don't propose to ventilate them publicly\".", "
Where does it go from here?
", "The committee is due to wrap up on Monday and then report to Parliament on Thursday. What happens from there may depend on what is in the report.", "There have\u00a0already been talks about potential votes of no confidence in Ms Chapman on the floor of Parliament.", "And because the government doesn't have control of the Lower House, there's a real possibility such a vote could get up."]
